short: Whether to show search suggestions in the omnibar
description: Controls whether search suggestions are displayed while typing in the omnibar. When enabled, the omnibar will fetch and display search suggestions from the configured search alias's suggestion API. This requires a valid suggestionURL to be configured for the search alias. The suggestions are fetched after a configurable delay (omnibarSuggestionTimeout) to avoid excessive API requests while the user is still typing.
valueDescription: Boolean flag to enable/disable search suggestions in the omnibar

values.description: Default value; search suggestions are fetched and displayed as the user types in the omnibar

notes: This is a boolean runtime setting that controls the availability of search suggestions in the omnibar. When enabled, the extension will make HTTP requests to the suggestion API of the configured search alias (e.g., Google Suggest, DuckDuckGo Suggest) while the user types. The actual suggestion request is delayed by omnibarSuggestionTimeout (default 200ms) to reduce the number of API calls and respect rate limits. This setting requires a valid suggestionURL to be configured for the search alias; if no suggestionURL is available, suggestions will not be shown regardless of this setting's value.
